Package HoleFillerLib

Class ConvolutionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • HoleFillerLib.ConvolutionUtils
  • class ConvolutionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Convolution implementation class, for internal use of hole-filling library in applying filters to 2D images.

    • Field Detail

      • DETECTOR_RIGHT_EDGE

        static final org.opencv.core.Mat DETECTOR_RIGHT_EDGE
        Common edge detection Kernels. The negative 1 in the center allows for quick orientation in performing convolutions (which losses data around the edges) without using fancy indexing

    • Method Detail

      • generateKernel

        static org.opencv.core.Mat generateKernel​(double[][] kernel,
                                          int rows,
                                          int cols)
        Generate simple kernels as matrices
        Parameters:
        kernel - kernel data to add into matrix
        rows - number of rows intended in result. must match kernel's dimensions
        cols - number of cols intended in result. must match kernel's dimensions
        Returns:
        A matrix resembling the input data

      • padMat

        static org.opencv.core.Mat padMat​(org.opencv.core.Mat original,
                                  int padWidth,
                                  int padHeight)
        Pad a matrix with a constant value around it's edges. For example, padding a single row on the top and bottom of the matrix with zeros: [[ 11, 12, 13, ..., 1n] [[ 0, 0, 0 , ..., 0] [ 21, 22, 23, ..., 2n] -o [ 11, 12, 13, ..., 1n] ... [ 21, 22, 23, ..., 2n] ... [ m1, m2, m3, ..., mn] ] [ m1, m2, m3, ..., mn] [ 0, 0, 0 , ..., 0] ]
        Parameters:
        original - matrix to be padded
        padWidth - how many columns to add at each end
        padHeight - how many rows to add on top and bottom
        Returns:
        a padded matrix with a shape larger than the original matrix

      • convolve2D

        static org.opencv.core.Mat convolve2D​(org.opencv.core.Mat input,
                                      org.opencv.core.Mat kernel)
        Takes a 2D array of grey-levels and a kernel and applies the convolution over the area of the image specified by width and height.
        Parameters:
        input - the 2D matrix representing the image with dimension of n X m [ [ 11, 12, 13, ..., 1n] , [ 21, 22, 23, ..., 2n] , ... [ m1, m2, m3, ..., mn] ]
        kernel - the 2D matrix representing the kernel with dimension of k X l [ [ 11, 12, ..., 1k] , ... [ l1, l2, ..., lk] ]
        Returns:
        the 2D array representing the new image
